      static byte[] concatAnyNumberOfByteArrays(byte[] firstArray, byte[]... rest)
      Concatenates any number of byte arrays (at least, until the computer running the program runs out of memory, or the resulting byte array becomes bigger than a Java array may ever be)
      static byte[] concatTwoByteArrays(byte[] firstArray, byte[] secondArray)
      A variation of the #concatAll(Object[], Object[]...) method to append one byte array to another without the usage of loops.

    • Method Detail

      • concatTwoByteArrays

        public static byte[] concatTwoByteArrays(byte[] firstArray,
                                         byte[] secondArray)
        A variation of the #concatAll(Object[], Object[]...) method to append one byte array to another without the usage of loops. If one of the arrays is null, this method returns the other array. If both arrays are null, it returns null.
        Parameters:
        firstArray - the array whose values shall comprise the first part of the result array
        secondArray - the array whose values shall comprise the second part of the result array
        Returns:
        the concatenated arrays
        Since:
        1.0

      • concatAnyNumberOfByteArrays

        public static byte[] concatAnyNumberOfByteArrays(byte[] firstArray,
                                                 byte[]... rest)
        Concatenates any number of byte arrays (at least, until the computer running the program runs out of memory, or the resulting byte array becomes bigger than a Java array may ever be)
        Parameters:
        firstArray -
        rest -
        Returns:
        the concatenation of all those arrays

      • concatAll

        public static <T> T[] concatAll(T[] first,
                                T[]... rest)
        concatenates any number of arrays of type T.
        Parameters:
        first - an array or type T[]
        rest - more arrays of type T[]
        Returns:
        the concatenation of all those arrays
